channel.title: Questions about Gentoo
channel.description:
I am currently using Ubuntu (and fairly happy with it). And I have a few questions about Gentoo.
1. Is it worth the install? I could probably do it provided I print the handbook, but I don't know whether or not it would be worth it.
2. Does Gentoo have an alternative to Debian/Ubutnu's "apt-get" or "aptitude" command? I use this function a lot, so yeah.
3. What's with the stage 1, 2, and 3 installs? I never understood this concept. Do you have to do all of them? Or just one? Or what?
4. I also read that I can just download the live CD and install through it. So I can use Gentoo, look at forums, view the online handbook, etc., while still actually installing Gentoo to my hard drive. Is this true?

@Zach1188 wrote:

Ok, I got Gentoo up and running (X, Gnome, and all). And I have to say it’s not at all what it’s cracked up to be. Yes, it’s faster. But it seems easy to break. And you constantly have to update your kernel to support new things.

So I honestly don’t think it’s worth it. It doesn’t seem all that much faster than Ubuntu.

And some more questions:

  1. How do I use the text browser?
    with the mouse, if that works, otherwise, you can use the keyboard, arrows and alt keys, also if you need support, press alt+f2, it’ll open a new terminal and open irssi/links in it

  3. Windows and (K)ubuntu is the only OS I have attempted to install. I am, however, very good with computers (been using them since I was 4). So what are my chances of installing Gentoo successfully
    [b]high, if you can follow tutorials and if you dare to ask the people in #gentoo on irc.freenode.net(don’t worry, they wont bite!)
    also, windows and (*)ubuntu is easy to install because it does most things you have to do yourself in gentoo.
    i actually suceeded with like 1% linux knowledge

but don’t worry, it isnt really hard to install gentoo, just be patient![/b][/quote]

item.title: Questions about Gentoo
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:2, topic:17721”]1. Is it worth the install? I could probably do it provided I print the handbook, but I don’t know whether or not it would be worth it.
well i think gentoo is pretty much worth the install, since it’s pretty fast(faster than ubuntu and stuff) because it isnt jammed with all kind of shit you dont need anyway, and everything is compiled when installing, instead of using binary’s

  1. Does Gentoo have an alternative to Debian/Ubutnu’s “apt-get” or “aptitude” command? I use this function a lot, so yeah.
    yep, emerge -a (this ask if you want to install it first, tho) and to search emerge -s , although for searching, i suggest getting eix(emerge -a eix) and use that.
    it is also very well documented at the gentoo site and the gentoo wiki

  2. What’s with the stage 1, 2, and 3 installs? I never understood this concept. Do you have to do all of them? Or just one? Or what?
    stage 1 takes longest to install, but everything is way faster, but it’s harder to install
    stage 3 is recommended since it’s easier to install and takes shorter, the downside is that your pc is a bit slower than with stage 1, but i’d really recommend stage 3, since its the only one supported in the handbook, but hey, it’s up to you!

  3. I also read that I can just download the live CD and install through it. So I can use Gentoo, look at forums, view the online handbook, etc., while still actually installing Gentoo to my hard drive. Is this true?
    Yeah, but i recommend using the CL installer instead of the gtk+ one, the CLI is way more flawless.
    but imho, the minimal cd is still the best because you can go on irc, visit forums with text browser, doesnt take to much resources for installing gentoo, and its way smaller

also, when/if you have gentoo, install conky, it’s one of the nicest monitoring apps :)[/quote]
